intro: Fagara kwangsiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi fagara, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to China. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant features compound leaves with elliptical leaflets and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are clustered berries that turn red when mature, attracting various wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
